title: Authors and Citation
text: Danielle Dempsey. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Dempsey D (2022). tgc: Thermal Growth Coefficient Model Aquaculture. R package version 0.1.3, https://dempsey-cmar.github.io/tgc/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tgc: Thermal Growth Coefficient Model for Aquaculture},   author = {Danielle Dempsey},   year = {2022},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://dempsey-cmar.github.io/tgc/}, }

what: Thermal Growth Coefficient Model for Aquaculture
title: Thermal Growth Coefficient Model for Aquaculture
text: Placeholder README. info come! goal tgc facilitate application Thermal-Unit Growth Coefficient (TGC) model aquaculture. package include functions identify stocked seasons, filter heat stress observations, apply TGC model, visualize results.

title: Thermal Growth Coefficient Model for Aquaculture
text: can install development version tgc GitHub :

title: Thermal Growth Coefficient Model for Aquaculture
text: function tip calls uses information function tail.

what: Calculate the thermal growth coefficient — TGC_calculate_coefficent
title: Calculate the thermal growth coefficient — TGC_calculate_coefficent
text: Calculate thermal growth coefficient

title: Calculate the thermal growth coefficient — TGC_calculate_coefficent
Calculate the thermal growth coefficient — TGC_calculate_coefficent
text: initial_weight vector initial weight(s) fish grams. final_weight vector final weight(s) fish grams. average_temp Average temperature growing days. n_days Number growing days.

title: Calculate the thermal growth coefficient — TGC_calculate_coefficent
text: Returns table columns INITIAL_WEIGHT, FINAL_WEIGHT, degree_days, TGC_COEF.

what:
Use TGC model to calculate degree days required to grow from initial to final
weight — TGC_calculate_degree_days
title:
Use TGC model to calculate degree days required to grow from initial to final
weight — TGC_calculate_degree_days
text: Use TGC model calculate degree days required grow initial final weight

title:
Use TGC model to calculate degree days required to grow from initial to final
weight — TGC_calculate_degree_days

Use TGC model to calculate degree days required to grow from initial to final
weight — TGC_calculate_degree_days
text: initial_weight vector initial weight(s) fish grams. final_weight vector final weight(s) fish grams. tgc vector thermal growth coefficient(s).

title:
Use TGC model to calculate degree days required to grow from initial to final
weight — TGC_calculate_degree_days
text: Returns table columns INITIAL_WEIGHT, FINAL_WEIGHT, TGC, TGC_DEGREE_DAYS.

what: Calculate final body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_final_weight
title: Calculate final body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_final_weight
text: Calculate final body weight using TGC model

title: Calculate final body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_final_weight
Calculate final body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_final_weight
text: dd_table Dataframe degree-day data, exported count_degree_days. Must include columns n_degree_days. initial_weight vector initial weight(s) fish grams. tgc vector thermal growth coefficient(s).

title: Calculate final body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_final_weight
text: Returns dd_table additional columns INITIAL_WEIGHT, TGC, TGC_FINAL_WEIGHT.

title: Calculate final body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_final_weight
text: Final weight calculated thermal growth coefficient (TGC) model: $$final_weight = (initial_weight^(1/3) + (TGC/1000)*degree_days)^3 $$ \(final_weight\) \(initial_weight\) kilograms. Final weight calculated combinations initial_weight tgc supplied arguments row dd_table.

what: Calculate initial body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_initial_weight
title: Calculate initial body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_initial_weight
text: Calculate initial body weight using TGC model

title: Calculate initial body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_initial_weight
Calculate initial body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_initial_weight
text: dd_table Dataframe degree-day data, exported count_degree_days. Must include columns n_degree_days. final_weight vector final weight(s) fish grams. tgc vector thermal growth coefficient(s).

title: Calculate initial body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_initial_weight
text: Returns dd_table additional columns FINAL_WEIGHT, TGC, TGC_INITIAL_WEIGHT.

title: Calculate initial body weight using TGC model — TGC_calculate_initial_weight
text: Initial weight calculated thermal growth coefficient (TGC) model: $$initial_weight = (final_weight^(1/3) - (TGC/1000)*degree_days)^3 $$ \(final_weight\) \(initial_weight\) kilograms. Initial weight calculated combinations initial_weight tgc supplied arguments row dd_table.

what: Apply filters to prepare data for degree-day calculation — apply_dd_filters
title: Apply filters to prepare data for degree-day calculation — apply_dd_filters
text: Apply filters prepare data degree-day calculation

title: Apply filters to prepare data for degree-day calculation — apply_dd_filters
code: apply_dd_filters(   dat,   trend_threshold = 4,   superchill_threshold = -0.7,   max_season = 540,   full_season = TRUE,   heat_threshold = 18,   n_hours = 24 )

title: Apply filters to prepare data for degree-day calculation — apply_dd_filters
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. trend_threshold threshold "trending ". Default trend_threshold = 4. last observation trend_threshold return trend_threshold triggers beginning growing season DEPTH group .... superchill_threshold threshold "superchill". Default superchill_threshold = -0.7. first observation superchill_threshold triggers end growing season group DEPTH .... max_season length growing season months groups temperature observations superchill_threshold. Default max_season = 540 days (~18 months). Note: units days adding 18 months August 30 August 31 results NA (February 30 February 31 real dates). full_season Logical argument. default, full_season = TRUE return data groups full season data (e.g., START_SEASON END_SEASON returned identify_growing_seasons(dat, full_season = TRUE) NA). full_season = FALSE, data groups returned; START_SEASON END_SEASON dates default first last timestamp ... DEPTH. heat_threshold threshold heat stress. Default heat_threshold = 18). Every observation heat_threshold triggers n-hour heat stress interval. n_hours Length heat stress interval hours (default n_hours = 24).

title: Apply filters to prepare data for degree-day calculation — apply_dd_filters
text: Returns dat filtered days used calculate degree-days DEPTH. Includes observations start 4-degree trending threshold end 1 minute first observation superchill season; observations occur heat stress events removed. additional column SEASON included label growing seasons ("S1", "S2", ...). observations may duplicated consecutive seasons.

what: Extract the most common value in a vector — calc_mode
title: Extract the most common value in a vector — calc_mode
text: Extract common value vector

title: Extract the most common value in a vector — calc_mode
Extract the most common value in a vector — calc_mode
text: v Vector extract mode.

what: Check for substantial gaps in the time series — check_for_data_gaps
title: Check for substantial gaps in the time series — check_for_data_gaps
text: Check substantial gaps time series

title: Check for substantial gaps in the time series — check_for_data_gaps
Check for substantial gaps in the time series — check_for_data_gaps
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. ... Additional columns dat use grouping variables. Results automatically grouped DEPTH. gap_length length time hours consider sampling gap. Default gap_length = 2 hours, twice sampling interval least frequent sensor. gap_warning length time hours consider substantial sampling gap. warning can printed gaps exceed duration. Default gap_warning = 6 hours. quiet Logical argument suppress Warning message gap lengths exceed gap_warning. quiet = TRUE, Warning printed.

title: Check for substantial gaps in the time series — check_for_data_gaps
text: Returns summary table GAP_START,GAP_LENGTH_DAYS, GAP_LENGTH_HOURS grouping variable intervals observations exceed gap_length. warning displayed intervals exceed gap_warning.

title: Count number of degree-days — count_degree_days
text: Count number degree-days

title: Count number of degree-days — count_degree_days
code: count_degree_days(   dat,   ...,   growing_days = NULL,   heat_threshold = 18,   n_hours = 24,   trend_threshold = 4,   superchill_threshold = -0.7,   max_season = 540,   full_season = TRUE,   rm_gap_days = FALSE,   gap_length = 2,   gap_warning = 6,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Count number of degree-days — count_degree_days
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. ... Additional columns dat use grouping variables. Results automatically grouped SEASON DEPTH. growing_days Optional dataframe including columns DEPTH, SEASON, ... (required) n_growing_days. provided, calculated using count_growing_days function. heat_threshold threshold heat stress. Default heat_threshold = 18). Every observation heat_threshold triggers n-hour heat stress interval. n_hours Length heat stress interval hours (default n_hours = 24). trend_threshold threshold "trending ". Default trend_threshold = 4. last observation trend_threshold return trend_threshold triggers beginning growing season DEPTH group .... superchill_threshold threshold "superchill". Default superchill_threshold = -0.7. first observation superchill_threshold triggers end growing season group DEPTH .... max_season length growing season months groups temperature observations superchill_threshold. Default max_season = 540 days (~18 months). Note: units days adding 18 months August 30 August 31 results NA (February 30 February 31 real dates). full_season Logical argument. default, full_season = TRUE return data groups full season data (e.g., START_SEASON END_SEASON returned identify_growing_seasons(dat, full_season = TRUE) NA). full_season = FALSE, data groups returned; START_SEASON END_SEASON dates default first last timestamp ... DEPTH. rm_gap_days Logical argument indicating whether remove days data gaps counting n_growing_days. gap_length length time hours consider sampling gap. Default gap_length = 2 hours, twice sampling interval least frequent sensor. total sample gap length (sum sample gaps) subtracted number stocked days calculate number growing days. gap_warning length time hours consider substantial sampling gap. warning can printed gaps exceed duration. Default gap_warning = 6 hours. quiet Logical argument suppress Warning message gap lengths exceed gap_warning. quiet = TRUE, Warning printed.

title: Count number of degree-days — count_degree_days
text: Returns tibble columns:

title: Count number of degree-days — count_degree_days
text: Degree-days = average temperature n days * n days n number days suitable growth (count_growing_days()). Results grouped SEASON, DEPTH, ....

title: Count number of degree-days — count_degree_days
text: Danielle Dempsey

what: Count number of days that were suitable for growth — count_growing_days
title: Count number of days that were suitable for growth — count_growing_days
text: Count number days suitable growth

title: Count number of days that were suitable for growth — count_growing_days
code: count_growing_days(   dat,   ...,   heat_threshold = 18,   n_hours = 24,   trend_threshold = 4,   superchill_threshold = -0.7,   max_season = 540,   full_season = TRUE,   rm_gap_days = FALSE,   gap_length = 2,   gap_warning = 6,   quiet = TRUE )

title: Count number of days that were suitable for growth — count_growing_days
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. ... Additional columns dat use grouping variables. Results automatically grouped SEASON DEPTH. heat_threshold threshold heat stress. Default heat_threshold = 18). Every observation heat_threshold triggers n-hour heat stress interval. n_hours Length heat stress interval hours (default n_hours = 24). trend_threshold threshold "trending ". Default trend_threshold = 4. last observation trend_threshold return trend_threshold triggers beginning growing season DEPTH group .... superchill_threshold threshold "superchill". Default superchill_threshold = -0.7. first observation superchill_threshold triggers end growing season group DEPTH .... max_season length growing season months groups temperature observations superchill_threshold. Default max_season = 540 days (~18 months). Note: units days adding 18 months August 30 August 31 results NA (February 30 February 31 real dates). full_season Logical argument. default, full_season = TRUE return data groups full season data (e.g., START_SEASON END_SEASON returned identify_growing_seasons(dat, full_season = TRUE) NA). full_season = FALSE, data groups returned; START_SEASON END_SEASON dates default first last timestamp ... DEPTH. rm_gap_days Logical argument indicating whether remove days data gaps counting n_growing_days. gap_length length time hours consider sampling gap. Default gap_length = 2 hours, twice sampling interval least frequent sensor. total sample gap length (sum sample gaps) subtracted number stocked days calculate number growing days. gap_warning length time hours consider substantial sampling gap. warning can printed gaps exceed duration. Default gap_warning = 6 hours. quiet Logical argument suppress Warning message gap lengths exceed gap_warning. quiet = TRUE, Warning printed.

title: Count number of days that were suitable for growth — count_growing_days
text: Returns tibble columns: ..., DEPTH, SEASON, START_SEASON (minimum TIMESTAMP group), END_SEASON (maximum TIMESTAMP group), STOCKED_DAYS (difftime(END_SEASON, START_SEASON, units = "days")), n_filtered_days (calculated identify_heat_stress_events), n_growing_days (STOCKED_DAYS - n_filtered_days).

title: Count number of days that were suitable for growth — count_growing_days
text: Days suitable growth days remain applying season heat stress filters. Option remove days data gaps (otherwise assumption temperature days average temperature data series). Results automatically grouped SEASON DEPTH. Runs filter_in_growing_seasons() SEASON column data. full season data, make sure set argument full_season = FALSE add SEASON column dat.

title: Count the maximum number of days VALUE exceeds a threshold (above or below) — count_max_event_days

Names columns used grouping variables (quoted), e.g. DEPTH, YEAR. less_than Logical argument. TRUE (default), function identify events VALUE threshold; FALSE, identify events VALUE threshold. summary_table Logical argument. TRUE (default), return summary table maximum event duration grouping variable. FALSE, return table exceedance events grouping variable.

what: Keep observations that occur during growing seasons — filter_in_growing_seasons
title: Keep observations that occur during growing seasons — filter_in_growing_seasons
text: Keep observations occur growing seasons

title: Keep observations that occur during growing seasons — filter_in_growing_seasons
code: filter_in_growing_seasons(   dat,   full_season = TRUE,   trend_threshold = 4,   superchill_threshold = -0.7,   max_season = 540 )

title: Keep observations that occur during growing seasons — filter_in_growing_seasons
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. full_season Logical argument. default, full_season = TRUE return data groups full season data (e.g., START_SEASON END_SEASON returned identify_growing_seasons(dat, full_season = TRUE) NA). full_season = FALSE, data groups returned; START_SEASON END_SEASON dates default first last timestamp ... DEPTH. trend_threshold threshold "trending ". Default trend_threshold = 4. last observation trend_threshold return trend_threshold triggers beginning growing season DEPTH group .... superchill_threshold threshold "superchill". Default superchill_threshold = -0.7. first observation superchill_threshold triggers end growing season group DEPTH .... max_season length growing season months groups temperature observations superchill_threshold. Default max_season = 540 days (~18 months). Note: units days adding 18 months August 30 August 31 results NA (February 30 February 31 real dates).

title: Keep observations that occur during growing seasons — filter_in_growing_seasons
text: Returns dat, filtered keep observations occur growing seasons identified identify_growing_seasons, additional column SEASON label seasons ("S1", "S2", ...). Observations may duplicated consecutive seasons.

title: Keep observations that occur during growing seasons — filter_in_growing_seasons
text: Keeps observations occur growing seasons defined identify_growing_seasons() (.e., filters observations occur growing seasons). growing season starts temperature crosses trend_threshold return trend_threshold (e.g., 4-degrees trending ) ends 1 minute first observation superchill_threshold. function looks START_SEASON January August avoid temperature drops caused hurricanes (typically September October) Winter cooling (November, December). function looks END_SEASON January May next year (spring superchill).

title: Filter out observations that occur during heat stress events — filter_out_heat_stress_events
Filter out observations that occur during heat stress events — filter_out_heat_stress_events
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. heat_threshold threshold heat stress. Default heat_threshold = 18). Every observation heat_threshold triggers n-hour heat stress interval. n_hours Length heat stress interval hours (default n_hours = 24).

title: Filter out observations that occur during heat stress events — filter_out_heat_stress_events
text: Returns dat, filtered remove observations occur heat stress events.

title: Filter out observations that occur during heat stress events — filter_out_heat_stress_events
text: Filters observations occur heat stress events, defined identify_heat_stress_events(). Every observation exceeds threshold corresponding heat stress interval (TIMESTAMP observation + n_hours). Intervals may overlap one intervals. Heat stress events denoted beginning end overlapping intervals depth. Heat stress events overlap, may end start consecutive timestamps.

Heat stress events denoted beginning end overlapping intervals depth. Heat stress events overlap, may end start consecutive timestamps.

code: identify_growing_seasons(   dat,   ...,   full_season = TRUE,   trend_threshold = 4,   superchill_threshold = -0.7,   max_season = 540 )

title: Identify start and end of growing seasons for each year — identify_growing_seasons
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. ... Additional columns dat use grouping variables. Results automatically grouped DEPTH. full_season Logical argument. default, full_season = TRUE return NA START_SEASON END_SEASON occur outside date range data series. example, data series starts temperature already trend_threshold, START_SEASON = NA; season length determined max_season, results date last observation, END_SEASON = NA. full_season = FALSE, START_SEASON END_SEASON dates default first last timestamp ... DEPTH. trend_threshold threshold "trending ". Default trend_threshold = 4. last observation trend_threshold return trend_threshold triggers beginning growing season DEPTH group .... superchill_threshold threshold "superchill". Default superchill_threshold = -0.7. first observation superchill_threshold triggers end growing season group DEPTH .... max_season length growing season months groups temperature observations superchill_threshold. Default max_season = 540 days (~18 months). Note: units days adding 18 months August 30 August 31 results NA (February 30 February 31 real dates).

title: Identify start and end of growing seasons for each year — identify_growing_seasons
text: Returns tibble START_SEASON, END_SEASON, SEASON_DAYS (length season days),  SEASON_MONTHS (season length months; assumes 1 month = 30 days) group DEPTH group ....

title: Identify start and end of growing seasons for each year — identify_growing_seasons
text: growing season starts temperature crosses trend_threshold return trend_threshold (e.g., 4-degrees trending ) ends 1 minute first observation superchill_threshold. function looks START_SEASON January August avoid temperature drops caused hurricanes (typically September October) Winter cooling (November, December). function looks END_SEASON January May next year (spring superchill). time series begins temperature trend_threshold, START_SEASON assigned minimum TIMESTAMP group filter_growing_season(). time series go superchill_threshold, growing season assumed max_season months long. END_SEASON assigned timestamp START_SEASON + days(max_season). Growing seasons may overlap max_season used determine END_SEASON.

title: Identify n-hour intervals beginning when a threshold is exceeded — identify_heat_stress_intervals
Identify n-hour intervals beginning when a threshold is exceeded — identify_heat_stress_intervals
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. ... Additional columns dat use grouping variables. Results automatically grouped DEPTH. heat_threshold threshold heat stress. Default heat_threshold = 18). Every observation heat_threshold triggers n-hour heat stress interval. n_hours Length heat stress interval hours (default n_hours = 24).

title: Identify n-hour intervals beginning when a threshold is exceeded — identify_heat_stress_intervals
text: Returns data frame columns: ...,  DEPTH, interval_start interval_end. interval_start indicates beginning heat stress interval, .e, TIMESTAMP observations VALUE greater equal heat_threshold. interval_end identifies end heat stress interval, .e., interval_start + n_hours. Note: intervals may overlap previous interval(s).

title: Identify when VALUE begins trending up — identify_trending_up
text: Identifies TIMESTAMP VALUE exceeds threshold return threshold, group DEPTH .... VALUE never crosses threshold temperature always > trend_threshold, date returned NA. VALUE = trend_threshold considered threshold.

title: Identify when VALUE begins trending up — identify_trending_up
code: data("string_data")  string_data <- string_data[which(string_data$VARIABLE == "Temperature"), ] trend_up <- identify_trending_up(string_data, trend_threshold = 4)

Variables must column(s) dat). single facet variable: facet_var =   "SEASON". one facet variables: facet_var = "SEASON +   DEPTH". Default facet_var = NULL. ncol Number columns faceted figure. what: Plot filtered data with removed data greyed out — plot_filtered_data
title: Plot filtered data with removed data greyed out — plot_filtered_data
text: Plot filtered data removed data greyed

title: Plot filtered data with removed data greyed out — plot_filtered_data
code: plot_filtered_data(   dat,   dat_filtered,   trend_threshold = 4,   superchill_threshold = -0.7,   heat_threshold = 18,   colour_palette = NULL,   legend_drop = FALSE,   legend_position = "right",   ylims = NULL,   date_axis_name = "Date",   date_breaks_major = NULL,   date_breaks_minor = NULL,   date_labels_format = NULL,   plotly_friendly = FALSE,   alpha = 1 )

title: Plot filtered data with removed data greyed out — plot_filtered_data
text: dat Data frame least three columns: TIMESTAMP (must possible convert POSIXct), DEPTH, VALUE. column VARIABLE included, must one unique entry. May also include columns grouping variables passed .... columns ignored. dat_filtered Filtered data, .e. result apply_dd_filters(dat). trend_threshold threshold "trending ". Default trend_threshold = 4. last observation trend_threshold return trend_threshold triggers beginning growing season DEPTH group .... superchill_threshold threshold "superchill". Default superchill_threshold = -0.7. first observation superchill_threshold triggers end growing season group DEPTH .... heat_threshold threshold heat stress. Default heat_threshold = 18). Every observation heat_threshold triggers n-hour heat stress interval. colour_palette Optional vector hex colors onto DEPTH mapped. colour_palette = NULL (default), reverse viridis colour palette used (option D). legend_drop Logical argument indicating whether drop unused depths legend. Default legend_drop = FALSE legend_position Position legend ("none", "left", "right", "bottom", "top"). Default legend_position = "right". ylims Numeric vector limits y-axis. date_axis_name Name x-axis. date_breaks_major Character string specifying intervals major breaks x-axis, e.g., date_breaks_major = "2 month". Default date_breaks_major = NULL, chooses breaks based length data series. date_breaks_minor Character string specifying intervals major breaks x-axis, e.g., date_breaks_minor = "1 month". Default date_breaks_minor = NULL, chooses breaks based length data series. date_labels_format Character string specifying format date labels x-axis, e.g., date_labels_format = "%y-%b". Default date_labels_format = NULL, chooses labels based length data series. plotly_friendly Logical argument. TRUE, y-axis label set plotly-friendly title ("Temperature (deg C)"). FALSE, expression() used insert degree symbol. alpha Transparency heat stress superchill shaded boxes.

title: Plot filtered data with removed data greyed out — plot_filtered_data
text: Returns ggplot object.
